topic.title: Modifying Error Messages in Bulk through Excel Upload

othermeta.name: shortdesc
othermeta.content: Explains how to upload multiple error messages in bulk using CSV import, field mapping, and validation options.

othermeta.name: usecase
othermeta.content: bulk import and validation of error messages

body.context:
You can import multiple error messages to the ERROR MESSAGE CONFIGURATOR page using a Microsoft Excel template workbook.
The high-level process of uploading error messages in bulk is as follows:
Export the template workbook.
Modify the error messages in the template workbook.
Import the updated workbook.

li.p: In the module menu, click Administration.
The ADMINISTRATION page is displayed.
In the navigation pane, expand the Configuration Toolkit folder, and then click Error Message Configurator.
The ERROR MESSAGE CONFIGURATOR list page is displayed.
Click Excel Import / Export, and then click Excel Template with Data.
An Excel workbook template with the details of all the available error messages in is downloaded to your local storage.
To modify the error messages in the Excel workbook, perform the following steps:
Open the Excel workbook.
Update the error message in the Value column.

p.note: You can also modify the variables in the dynamic messages if you are familiar with the specific dynamic variables to be inserted.

li.p: Save the Excel workbook with the modified error messages.
To import the updated Excel workbook to , perform the following steps:
Click Excel Import / Export, and then click Excel Import.
The IMPORT DETAILS FROM EXCEL FILE page is displayed.
To select the updated Excel workbook, click Choose File.
The Open dialog box is displayed.
Browse and select the appropriate Excel workbook, and then click Open.
Click Upload.

validates the information in the Excel workbook for any errors.
If there are any errors, an error log is generated that includes all the issues that must be resolved.
You can click Error Log in the toolbar to download the error log to your local storage.
If no errors are found, detects the new messages that are not currently available in the application but created and uploaded through import with a GUID/Key and Culture. It displays those new messages in a separate grid. The existing messages that are updated are displayed in a separate grid, along with a comparison between the existing information in and the updated information uploaded in the Excel workbook. You can choose whether to update or retain the previous information by selecting or deselecting the check box.
If no errors are found, detects the new messages that are not currently available in the application but uploaded through import without a GUID/Key. In such cases, a GUID/Key is generated and assigned to each message, and displays them in a separate grid.
Click Save.
The updated error messages in the Excel workbook are uploaded to the ERROR MESSAGE CONFIGURATOR list page.
